name: BirdProject Soap, Lovebirds Edition
description:
Love the Coast. This new ceramic birdie wears a red heart at its tail which is created by two fingerprints in red glaze that are handprinted at an angle to form the heart. 

“Look at every path closely and deliberately, then ask ourselves this crucial question: Does this path have a heart? If it does, then the path is good. If it doesn't then it is of no use to us.” - Carlos Castaneda

"Where there is love there is life."  - Mahatma Gandhi

♥ ♥ ♥

Each black, bird shaped soap contains a white, ceramic bird, handmade by moi from Louisiana Clay, which remains as a keepsake once the outer soap has washed away.

Through the daily act of washing, you will eventually free the clean, white, ceramic birds inside - potent symbols of restoration and recovery. The soap is shaped to be cradled in your hand and is a powerful representation of all creatures affected by the BP Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Disaster.

The soaps are made with natural, locally sourced ingredients: biodiesel glycerin, fair trade olive oil, aloe, activated black charcoal, and a light cypress scent - reminiscent of Louisianan bayous. They are made by Emily Manger Davis of Sweet Olive Soaps, a third generation soapmaker from New Orleans. 

50% of profits go to environmental cleanup and care for affected animals of the BP Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Disaster. [Gulf Restoration Network & IBRRC] $18,000 donated to date and counting!

A beautiful sculpture for your home, a fantastic soap, and a meaningful gift which gives to many.

name: *new* BirdProject Soap, Beau Ciel Bleu Edition
description:
I am delighted to bring to you a new edition of Blue ceramic birds, Beau Ciel Bleu (Beautiful Blue Skies in French). 

Each black, bird shaped soap contains a beautiful, blue ceramic bird, handmade from Louisiana Clay in New Orleans, which remains as a keepsake once the outer soap has washed away.

Through the daily act of washing, you will eventually free the clean, white, ceramic birds inside - potent symbols of restoration and recovery. The soap is shaped to be cradled in your hand and is a powerful representation of all creatures affected by the BP Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Disaster.

The soaps are made with natural, locally sourced ingredients: biodiesel glycerin, fair trade olive oil, aloe, activated black charcoal, and a light cypress scent - reminiscent of Louisianan bayous. They are made by Emily Manger Davis of Sweet Olive Soaps, a third generation soapmaker from New Orleans. 

These blue birdies have been a long time in the making! When we switched to slipcasting our ceramic birds our firing temperature changed & also required a change in glazes. Luckily, Brooke Cassady the amazing woman who makes our ceramic birdies is able to create this unique, beautiful blue glaze.

50% of profits go to environmental cleanup and care for affected animals of the BP Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Disaster. (Gulf Restoration Network & International Bird Rescue)

A beautiful sculpture for your home, a fantastic soap, and a meaningful gift which gives to many.

+ If in New Orleans, happy to arrange pickup & refund shipping! 

+ More details about the soaps! They are all natural [they contain no shea butter or animal products - I've received many thank you's for that for those that are allergic] and are really wonderful for your skin. The lovely soap is great for all skin types and is not drying for daily use. The heavenly Rigaud Cypress scent has a rich history which began in Paris in 1850 and is delightful for both women and men.

~ To prolong the life of handmade soap please keep in a soap dish and allow to dry between uses. Store in a cool and dry place until ready for use.

name: BirdProject Soap
description:
~ BirdProject Soap is a thoughtful gift which gives to many. Each black, bird shaped soap contains a white, ceramic bird, handmade by moi from Louisiana Clay, which remains as a keepsake once the outer soap has washed away. 

Through the daily act of washing, you will eventually free the clean, white, ceramic birds inside - potent symbols of restoration and recovery. The soap is shaped to be cradled in your hand and is a powerful representation of all creatures affected by the BP Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Disaster.

The soaps are made with natural, locally sourced ingredients: biodiesel glycerin, fair trade olive oil, aloe, activated black charcoal, and a light cypress scent - reminiscent of Louisianan bayous.  They are made by Emily Manger Davis of Sweet Olive Soaps, a third generation soapmaker from New Orleans.  

50% of profits go to environmental cleanup and care for affected animals of the BP Deepwater Horizon Oil Spill Disaster. (Gulf Restoration Network & IBRRC) $18,000 donated and counting, thanks to all of your wonderful support!!

** I've also received so many letters that this pretty handsoap beats out other soaps in the house for removing tough stains or dirt on your hands. Even stubborn paint, tree sap, & crawfish boil residue!

name: TOTE-ally Awesome Market Tote!
description:
Eco-happy reusable, 100% recycled cotton canvas shopping bag for your shopping pleasure screenprinted with Love the Coast logo in Eco Inks. Come in both green or black!

This tote is sturdy and size-able: holds books, groceries, etc. yet also a good size for an everyday around the city bag.

+ Wash instructions: wash in cold water, dry flat

name: Love the Coast - TEE
description:
Originally created for our participation in the Big Idea event during New Orleans Entrepreneur Week! Everyone loved them so much (AND they look so GREAT on everyone!), we decided to bring them into the Matter Line!

These awesome shirts are available in 3 styles:

Unisex Awesome Vee-Neck on American Apparel tees, 100% Cotton - sizing chart here: S, M, L, XL (*American Apparel states women may prefer to get one size smaller)

Men's Cool Crew-Neck, 100% Cotton, pre-shrunk: M, L (these run big)

Printed with Water-based Inks on super soft shirts by our good friends at Purple Monkey in the Bywater. 

♥ ♥ ♥
